userReview: An excellent course, stupendous I might say; condensed and full of practical advices. For a beginer, i think it's a must do. I'm anxious to follow your courses on responsive websites, and then javascript. A big thank you.

Sir Jonas is ONE of my favorite instructors in Web Development because his course is very-well structured and the content was delivered to the students proficiently. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Sir Jonas to anyone who wants to learn Full-Stack Web Development. Love it!

It is great that I found this free tutorial with Sir Jonas! It is very helpful for a beginner like me to understand how to make my own website and how does it flow. Again, thank you so much and have a great day!

The course discusses the tools one needs to design and develop a great website. I enjoyed learning about WHY these practices are good to follow. It is a course I will keep on referring to as my design skills improve.
Even wat problemen met geluid dat het weg viel. Inhoud is goed.

For a 1 hour course, it was good. Very basic information about designing a website, somethings I might have overlooked. But I would have preferred more examples without a border, which reduces the size of the examples. Also, detailing how to structure planning the website from the very start. Links to the resources would also be very helpful.
No how to's, just talking. Guess I can't complain because it's free but I wouldn't classify it as a course. I would instead call it and now a word with the instructor.

There are some errors in the cc translation (ex. Funds instead of Fonts) The voice is too mechanical. The course is based on a non existed e-book. The reference instead is an endless site with no guidance on how to approach it
The author didn't write one line of code, only common words. This is not a course, this is a list of advice. I strongly recommend to not waste your time on this course.
The course does not reflect its objective , It was nothing like what I thought it would be. After the course no way you are able to design a web or even way to do it.
